arts.ttl: Man United 4-2 Brighton: Post-Match Man United Player Ratings
arts.sum: With high expectations, United started strong and pressed high to unsettle Brighton in every possible moment. Casemiro played brilliant line-breaking passes and looked to be progressive on the half-turn to really push the tempo of the game, with the balls being played behind.

arts.ttl: Man Utd ‘suffer’ against Brighton as Mbeumo seals third successive win
arts.sum: The home team kept the pressure on and Cunha moved the ball out from under his feet following a pass from Casemiro and slotted a fine finish into the far corner to open his United account. After last week’s triumph at Liverpool secured United their first back-to-back league wins under Amorim, the task that now befell them was to kick on and make it three in a row by defeating an opponent that had won their last three games at Old Trafford.

arts.ttl: Man Utd put four past Brighton for third successive win
arts.sum: Bryan Mbeumo scores twice as Manchester United win 4-2 against Brighton and claim a third successive Premier League win for the first time since February 2024.

arts.ttl: Four things we learnt from Man United’s 4-2 win over Brighton
arts.sum: Coming off the back of a statement victory at Anfield, United followed it up with another strong performance and three crucial points - a sign that Amorim’s project might finally be taking shape. Manchester United secured a third successive win for the first time under Rúben Amorim, beating Brighton 4–2 at Old Trafford in an entertaining Premier League clash.

arts.ttl: Man United 4-2 Brighton: Resurgent United survive late scare to make it three wins in a row
arts.sum: Then, just after the hour, Bryan Mbeumo planted a third into Bart Verbruggen’s net to all but secure victory, despite Danny Welbeck converting a well-taken free-kick and Charalampos Kostoulas finishing to pull two late goals back. As simple as the play was, Brighton really should have done more to relegate the chance on the edge of their box, which saw Fernandes and Casemiro move the ball from right-to-left, before Cunha grabbed it and made space from 20 yards out.

arts.ttl: Man Utd's €225m frontline tear apart Brighton as Ruben Amorim celebrates three straight wins
arts.sum: Manchester United have been forced to wait a while for their €225.7million front three to get firing. But at long last, things are clicking into place for Rúben Amorim after witnessing...

arts.ttl: Manchester United player ratings vs Brighton as Bryan Mbeumo and Matheus Cunha shine
arts.sum: Manchester United secured a 4-2 win over Brighton and Hove Albion in the Premier League on Saturday evening, with Bryan Mbeumo and Matheus Cunha each finding the scoresheet at Old Trafford

arts.ttl: Manchester United build momentum as Bryan Mbeumo double sinks Brighton
arts.sum: A Ruben Amorim pirouette and revolving fist-pump greeted Bryan Mbeumo putting Manchester United 3-0 up and told the tale of how precious this third consecutive league victory was. But the goal came on 61 minutes and still United found themselves clinging on at 3-2 deep into added time before Mbeumo smashed home his second, after the Cameroonian ran on to Kobbie Mainoo’s pass from the centre circle. Almost instantly Anthony Taylor blew for time and “Glory, glory Man United” was blared from the PA. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Gary Neville reveals ‘big job’ for Amorim after Man Utd see off Brighton
arts.sum: While Bryan Mbeumo and Matheus Cunha both won praise from the Man Utd legend, who pointed out that some of the risk of those signings was taken away due to their Premier League experience, Neville has greater reservations over the form of Sesko. Manchester United might have clocked up a third Premier League victory in succession with a 4-2 win over Brighton at Old Trafford, but Gary Neville believes that Ruben Amorim still has a “big job” to integrate Benjamin Sesko fully into the team.

arts.ttl: Man Utd make it three in a row with PL win over Brighton
arts.sum: FREE TO WATCH: Highlights from Manchester United's match against Brighton in the Premier League.
